title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015 

(Apprentices’ Fees) Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited solicitor act 1954 2015 (apprentices fees) regulation 2023

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on the 1st day of January
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall come into operation on the 1st day of January 
2024 and The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015 (Apprentices’ Fees) Regulations, 
2022 (S.I. No. 269 of 2022) shall from that date stand revoked.
text_norm: 2 regulation shall come operation 1st day january 2024 solicitor act 1954 2015 (apprentices fees) regulation 2022 (s.i no 269 2022) shall date stand revoked

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: (a) The words and phrases in these Regulations and in the Schedule
text_raw:
3. 

(a) The words and phrases in these Regulations and in the Schedule 
hereto shall have the meanings respectively assigned by the 
Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015 and, except insofar as may be 
inconsistent there-with, the provisions of the Solicitors Acts 
1954 to 1994 (Apprenticeship and Education) Regulations, 2001 
(S.I. No. 546 of 2001) and the provisions of the Solicitors Acts 
1954 to 2011 (Apprenticeship and Education) (Amendment) 
Regulations, 2019 (S.I. No. 503 of 2019). 

(b) The Interpretation Act 2005 shall apply for the purposes of the 
interpretation of these Regulations as it applies for the purposes 
of the interpretation of an Act of the Oireachtas, except 
insofar as it may be inconsistent with the provisions of the 
Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015 or The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 
1994 (Apprenticeship and Education) Regulations, 2001 (S.I. 
No. 546 of 2001) or The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2011 
(Apprenticeship and Education) (Amendment) Regulations, 
2019 (S.I. No. 503 of 2019) or these Regulations.
text_norm: 3 (a) word phrase regulation schedule hereto shall meaning respectively assigned solicitor act 1954 2015 except insofar may inconsistent there-with provision solicitor act 1954 1994 (apprenticeship education) regulation 2001 (s.i no 546 2001) provision solicitor act 1954 2011 (apprenticeship education) (amendment) regulation 2019 (s.i no 503 2019) (b) interpretation act 2005 shall apply purpose interpretation regulation applies purpose interpretation act oireachtas except insofar may inconsistent provision solicitor act 1954 2015 solicitor act 1954 1994 (apprenticeship education) regulation 2001 (s.i no 546 2001) solicitor act 1954 2011 (apprenticeship education) (amendment) regulation 2019 (s.i no 503 2019) regulation

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: 4. As and from the date on which these Regulations shall come into
text_raw:
4. As and from the date on which these Regulations shall come into 
operation, the fees specified in the Schedule hereto shall be paid to the Law 
Society of Ireland in respect of courses and examinations provided for in 
The Solicitors Acts 1954 
to 1994 (Apprenticeship and Education) 
Regulations, 2001 (S.I. No. 546 of 2001) and The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 
2011 (Apprenticeship and Education) (Amendment) Regulations, 2019 (S.I. 
No. 503 of 2019). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 8th December, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 SCHEDULE 

within referred to

Signed on behalf of the Law Society of Ireland pursuant to Section 79 of the 
Solicitors Act 1954. 
 30 November 2023 

BARRY MACCARTHY, 
 President of the Law Society of Ireland 

Pursuant to the provisions of Section 82 (2) (as amended by Section 25 (1) of 
the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1960 and Section 66 of the Solicitors 
(Amendment) Act, 1994) of the Solicitors Act, 1954, I concur with the 
making of these Regulations, 

 5 December 2023 

MR JUSTICE DAVID BARNIVILLE, 
 President of the High Court

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The principal purpose of the Instrument is to provide for increases in the fees 
payable to the Law Society of Ireland in respect of courses and examinations 
provided for in The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 1994 (Apprenticeship and 
Education) Regulations, 2001 (S.I. No. 546 of 2001) and The Solicitors Acts 
1954 to 2011 (Apprenticeship and Education) (Amendment) Regulations, 2019 
(S.I. No. 503 of 2019) operative from the 1st day of January 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [602] 7
